title: Source: Dolphins releasing pass rusher Chubb
content: The Dolphins are releasing pass rusher Bradley Chubb after four seasons with the franchise, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Edwards, Wemby 'set tone' for competitive ASG
content: Anthony Edwards led Team Stars to a victory in the revamped NBA All-Star Game, earning MVP honors after a refreshingly competitive display by the stars involved.

title: Kansas St. fires Tang after rant, one Big 12 win
content: Jerome Tang, who led Kansas State to the Elite Eight in his first season but has failed to replicate that success in his three seasons since, was fired for cause by the school.

title: Malinin hints at 'inevitable crash' amid pressure
content: Ilia Malinin posted a video on social media juxtaposing images of his many triumphs with a black-and-white image of the U.S. figure skater with his head buried in his hands, and a caption hinting at an "inevitable crash" amid the pressure of the Olympics.

title: Brown refutes Beverly Hills' account of shutdown
content: Celtics star Jaylen Brown said the City of Beverly Hills' explanation for shutting down his brand event Saturday night was "completely false."

title: Johnson, ex-Pro Bowl Washington OL, dies at 54
content: Tre' Johnson, the former standout NFL offensive lineman with Washington who went on to become a Maryland high school history teacher, died Sunday. He was 54.

title: U.S. men stay unbeaten; 2-seed for knockouts
content: Auston Matthews scored twice and set up Zach Werenski's goal with a textbook pass, Connor Hellebuyck stopped 23 of the 24 shots he faced, and the U.S. defeated Germany 5-1 on Sunday night to finish group play at the Olympics unbeaten.

title: Reddick races to Daytona win in Jordan-owned car
content: Tyler Reddick won the Daytona 500 in a car owned by Michael Jordan when Chase Elliott crashed as he and Reddick were battling for the win.

title: The 11 trades we want to see this NFL offseason: Barnwell finds new homes for 15 players
content: DJ Moore and A.J. Brown to the AFC West? Kyler Murray in a new offense? Rams going all-in again? And a new WR1 for the Bills? Let's build 11 win-win deals.

title: Reddick's Daytona 500 win a buzzer-beater befitting of his boss: Michael Jordan
content: The race itself was a near-perfect representation of what the Daytona 500 has become in recent years.

title: The ultimate debate: Skubal or Skenes? Buster Olney ranks the top 10 starting pitchers in MLB
content: We break down the best players at every spot on the diamond entering 2026, starting with a star-studded position featuring two of baseball's biggest stars.

title: Grades, lessons learned and big questions from Team USA's 5-1 win over Germany
content: An American win seemed inevitable, sending the team through to the quarterfinals. Here's what stood out the most.

title: Purpose and togetherness: What the soccer world can learn from FA Cup heroes Macclesfield
content: Macclesfield produced one of soccer's greatest Cinderella stories in beating Crystal Palace in the FA Cup, but the tale behind the triumph is even more remarkable.

title: Answering key offseason questions for every NFL team: Intel on free agency, QB decisions and draft options
content: Which teams will make a splash move? Which teams must make adjustments? We answered big offseason questions.

title: LaMelo to DeMar: Which L.A. NBA stars would've made an All-Star roster in high school?
content: From LaMelo Ball to James Harden, these Los Angeles NBA stars' high school résumés would land them on an All-Star roster.

title: WNBA mock draft: Who follows Azzi Fudd at No. 1?
content: Awa Fam, Olivia Miles, Lauren Betts and Flau'jae Johnson follow Fudd, the projected top pick in April's draft.

title: Win projections for all 30 MLB teams -- and how the offseason changed expectations
content: Fans love a big splash but don't always get one. Here's what some non-moves mean for each team's playoff forecast.

title: College baseball Week 1: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: With upsets of top teams and electric plays across the whole sport, how did the top 25 rankings shake out?

title: College football had an incredible season. Remember how we got here
content: The sport's manifest destiny opened doors for Indiana and others. Consolidating power and access could eliminate the thrill of that growth.

title: Inter-Juve ruined by one of the worst refereeing decisions; Liverpool turn a corner?
content: The big game of the Serie A weekend was ruined by a big refereeing error; what matters now is making sure it doesn't happen again. Plus: Liverpool show more signs of recovery, and Vini Jr. steps up for Real Madrid.

title: Is soccer better without VAR? FA Cup shows nobody really knows
content: Neither the third or fourth rounds of the FA Cup used VAR, yet they produced opposite reactions on whether soccer needs the technology.

title: No more Rivalry Week? Explaining MLS' new schedule format for 2026
content: The new MLS season for 2026 is about to begin, and with it comes changes to the league's schedule. So what exactly is the plan?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye Real Madrid teenager Valdepeñas
content: Real Madrid's Victor Valdepeñas is among Arsenal's favored options as Mikel Arteta aims to further reinforce his back line in the summer. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Lapsed fan guide: Dodgers rule, offseason moves, trades, more
content: Everything you need to know about the 2026 season for the fan who has been away and is looking to dive back in.

title: Fantasy draft guide: Rankings, tips, strategy, stats and more
content: All the rankings, projections, cheat sheets, strategy and analysis you need for the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

title: Who's really fastest in 2026? F1's new rules are confusing the pecking order -- and the drivers
content: Formula 1's new era was always going to bring questions, but its first week of serious running has raised more than most. With one more preseason test in Bahrain still to come, ESPN makes sense of a fascinating three days in Sakhir.

title: 'If Pakistan had won…': Kaif fires back at Shoaib Akhtar in fiery on-air moment
content: India secured a significant win against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup. Former player Mohammed Kaif believes the focus has been too much on Pakistan's struggles. He highlights India's skill and composure under immense pressure. Players like Ishan Kishan delivered outstanding performances. This victory demonstrates India's ability to perform when stakes are high.

title: Maduro's gone — But is Venezuela witnessing a new 'Don'?
content: Venezuela is in a new political phase after President Nicolas Maduro's removal. Delcy Rodriguez now leads an interim administration. Diplomatic ties with Washington are restoring. The oil sector is opening to private operators. Hundreds of detainees have been released. However, the security apparatus remains. Elections are not yet announced. Key figures of the old establishment continue in power.

title: From Moran to Mach 2.8: Inside IAF's night-ready war machines
content: India has opened a new emergency landing strip in Assam. This facility is part of a larger plan to create multiple air bases across the country. The move enhances India's air power and survivability. It signals a strategic shift in defense doctrine. This development strengthens India's readiness for modern warfare scenarios.

title: 'Gussa chodh do bhai': Suryakumar Yadav’s message to Kuldeep Yadav goes viral
content: India secured a commanding 61-run victory over Pakistan in the T20 World Cup, clinching their spot in the Super Eight. Despite the dominant win, an animated exchange between Hardik Pandya and Kuldeep Yadav sparked social media debate, quickly diffused by captain Suryakumar Yadav's heartwarming gesture.

title: 'It is not cool': Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei warns rivals on AI spending
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei cautioned rivals against excessive AI capital spending, warning of "catastrophic miscalculations." He highlighted the uncertainty of AI's economic returns, stating that even slight revenue growth deviations could lead to bankruptcy if data center investments are too aggressive. Amodei defended Anthropic's more measured approach despite significant infrastructure plans.

title: Ramadan Mubarak 2026: Top 50 Ramzan wishes, messages, quotes and more
content: Ramadan 2026 begins around February 18-19 in India, marking a period of fasting, prayer, and reflection for Muslims. This sacred month, one of Islam's pillars, emphasizes spiritual growth and community. It culminates in Eid ul-Fitr on March 19-20, a joyous festival celebrating the end of the fast.

title: Tamil Nadu: Congress vs Congress erupts as Stalin refuses to blink
content: Tamil Nadu's power-sharing debate has ignited friction between Congress and DMK, exposing internal Congress rifts. State leadership is silencing dissent, with TNCC chief rebuking MP Manickam Tagore for raising the issue publicly. CM Stalin firmly rejected power-sharing demands, calling them a conspiracy, while asserting alliance strength.

title: 'Don't lecture us, you can go...': Pentagon's warning to Anthropic
content: The Pentagon is reportedly considering ending its partnership with AI firm Anthropic over restrictions on military use of its technology. Anthropic refuses to allow its AI for mass surveillance of citizens or fully autonomous weapons, frustrating defense officials. While other companies are more accommodating, Anthropic's firm stance on ethical guardrails could lead to a complete termination of their collaboration.

title: Designer rice on your plate soon? CSIR-NIIST transfers tech to private firms
content: CSIR–NIIST is set to transfer its innovative designer rice technology, enriched with protein and micronutrients while boasting a lower glycaemic impact. This initiative aims to transform polished white rice into a healthier staple, with licenses granted to Tata Consumer Products Ltd and SS Soul Foods. The event will also see the transfer of other advanced technologies.

title: 'You have 5 years': Rajnath's 'challenge' for DRDO to develop 5th & 6th gen aero-engines
content: ​Speaking at the Gas Turbine Research Establishment in Bengaluru, defence minister Rajnath Singh said the establishment, functioning under the  DRDO, has become "the foundation of India's strategic capability," crediting its scientists for consistently delivering successful tests and strengthening the country's defence preparedness. Rajnath Singh acknowledged the deadline as a challenge; however, he said it should not come "as a shock or a surprise."​​

title: Trisha Krishnan issues legal warning over distasteful remarks and political linking
content: Actress Trisha Krishnan has issued a strong legal statement. She is slamming distasteful remarks and any linking to politics. Krishnan stated she wishes to be defined solely by her craft. She emphasized her neutral stance on political matters. The actress requested her name not be dragged into unrelated issues. Her privacy and professional identity deserve respect.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife MacKenzie Scott on her inspiration for huge donations
content: MacKenzie Scott attributes her philanthropic approach to early acts of kindness, recalling a college roommate's loan and a dentist's free care. Since 2020, she has donated approximately 58 million Amazon shares, totaling billions through her Yield Giving organization, which supports diverse causes like education and DEI.

title: Watch: Drunk man naps on track as train stops inches away
content: A man, reportedly intoxicated, was found sleeping on a railway track at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, halting Harbour Line services and delaying thousands of commuters. The incident, captured in a viral video, saw the train stop just in time, preventing a tragedy. Operations resumed after the man was safely removed.

title: From 'chaiwala' to 'Rahulian': Aiyar returns; Cong ducks for cover, again
content: Mani Shankar Aiyar has once again embarrassed the Congress with his remarks, first praising Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan and then dismissing the party's leadership, including spokesperson Pawan Khera. The Congress has distanced itself from Aiyar, stating he has no connection with the party. This incident follows a pattern of Aiyar's controversial statements that have previously aided the BJP.

title: Elon Musk’s X outage: Twitter down for thousands globally, including India
content: Elon Musk's social media platform X is experiencing a significant global technical outage, impacting thousands of users across the US, India, and Europe. Reports began surfacing around 7:10 PM on Monday, with users encountering blank timelines and error messages. Both mobile and desktop versions of the platform are affected by the widespread disruption.

title: JEE Main 2026 session 1 result released: Direct link to download here
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has declared the JEE Main 2026 Session 1 results on its official portals, jeemain.nta.ac.in and ntaresults.nic.in. Candidates can download their scorecards using their application number and date of birth. The results include percentile scores, All India Rank, category-wise rank, and subject-wise performance. Over 13 lakh students appeared, with the top 2.5 lakh eligible for JEE Advanced 2026. Session 2 is scheduled from April 2 to 9, 2026.

title: 'Terrible mistake': Pakistan's big blunder vs India exposed
content: Ravichandran Ashwin criticised Pakistan's decision to bowl first after winning the toss in their T20 World Cup loss to India, deeming it the match's turning point. He highlighted Pakistan's tactical errors, including bowling choices and pressure handling, as key factors in their defeat.

title: 'Is he a ghost?' How a spirit found a place in my pooja room and became our God
content: In a village pooja room, a Brahmin family worshipped not only deities but also a guardian spirit, Ranga Dhari, and a local Sufi saint, Pir Baba. This layered faith, blending Hindu and Sufi traditions, reflected a deep connection to land, family, and protection, where a 'ghost' was revered as a protector. The sacred space held history and inheritance, not contradiction.

title: CBSE releases notice ahead of board exams: Warns of strict action over fake paper leak claims
content: CBSE Class X and XII board examinations begin on February 17, 2026, with the Board issuing a strong warning against fake question paper leak claims on social media. The Central Board of Secondary Education has urged students and parents to ignore rumours, rely only on official sources, and assured strict security measures for fair conduct.

title: Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda reception invite goes viral after wedding buzz
content: Speculation is rife as reports suggest Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna are set to marry on February 26, with a destination wedding in Udaipur and a Hyderabad reception on March 4. A viral invite, though unconfirmed, hints at a celebration with loved ones.

title: 'Rowdy Venugopal, puppet Khera': Aiyer's name-calling spree against 'Rahulian' Congress
content: Mani Shankar Aiyar invoked B.R. Ambedkar after the Congress distanced itself from his praise of Kerala's Pinarayi Vijayan government. Aiyar criticized Rahul Gandhi and Pawan Khera, calling Khera a "puppet" and "parrot." He expressed contempt for Khera and questioned the party's handling of dissent, contrasting it with Nehru's era.

title: Stock market today: Top gainers and losers on Feb 16? Check list
content: Indian equity markets staged a strong comeback on Monday, with the Sensex and Nifty surging nearly 1 percent. This rebound was fueled by robust buying in power, banking, and financial stocks. The positive sentiment was further bolstered by easing US bond yields and expectations of monetary easing, alongside stability in the rupee and crude oil prices.

title: New record! China laps up discounted Russian crude as India reduces purchases
content: Supplies of Urals, along with other export grades such as Sokol and Varandey, have added to regular shipments of Russia’s flagship ESPO blend exported from the Far East port of Kozmino, which is geographically closer to China.

title: Rajpal Yadav gets relief: Delhi HC grants interim bail in cheque bounce case
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav has been granted interim bail by the Delhi High Court in cheque bounce cases after depositing Rs 1.5 crore. The court suspended his sentence, allowing him to remain out of custody until March 18, with conditions including a personal bond and surety. His wife expressed gratitude for industry support amidst speculation about debt repayment.

title: 'Fact, fiction and WhatsApp forwards': Karti Chidambaram on his 'cameo' in Dhurandhar
content: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram has dismissed social media claims linking him and his father, former Union minister P Chidambaram, to a scene in the film Dhurandhar. He stated the allegations are a mix of fact, fiction, and WhatsApp forwards, questioning the lack of official records if such an event had occurred.

title: From Rs 2 fees to village transformation: A doctor couple’s story
content: In the 1980s, Dr. Ravindra Kolhe ventured into Maharashtra's remote Bairagarh, offering healthcare for nominal fees. Joined by his wife, Dr. Smita, they expanded their mission beyond medicine, tackling poverty and agricultural issues. Their unwavering dedication, recognized with a Padma Shri, transformed the community, proving that lasting change stems from persistent service where it's needed most.

title: CBSE clarifies eligibility for Class 10 two board exams policy: First exam mandatory for all
content: CBSE has clarified new Class 10 Board Exam rules starting 2026. Appearing in the first exam is mandatory; missing three or more subjects disqualifies students from the second attempt. The second exam is for improvement, compartment, or eligible replacement categories only. Additional subjects are not permitted, emphasizing the importance of appearing for all subjects initially.

title: Russia rejects Alexei Navalny poisoning charge, 'naturally'
content: Russia has dismissed accusations from European nations that it poisoned Alexei Navalny with epibatidine as "biased and baseless."  Britain, Sweden, France, Germany and the Netherlands said in a joint statement on Saturday that they believe Navalny was poisoned with epibatidine, a toxic substance derived from poison dart frogs. While the US is not disputing the charge, it has refrained from direct comments. Navalny, a prominent critic of Vladimir Putin, died in February 2024 at an Arctic penal colony.

title: 'Shooting' video row: SC refuses to hear pleas against Assam CM; flags ‘disturbing trend’
content: The Supreme Court declined to hear pleas for an FIR and SIT probe against Himanta Biswa Sarma concerning a controversial video, directing petitioners to the Gauhati High Court. Justices questioned the bypass of lower courts, deeming it an "undermining" of their authority and a concerning election-eve trend. The bench urged constitutional restraint.

title: Rohit Shetty residence firing case: Mumbai Crime Branch nabs main shooter
content: The Mumbai Police Crime Branch has successfully detained the lead gunman connected to the recent shooting incident at the home of filmmaker Rohit Shetty in Rajasthan, alongside five other individuals. With this latest roundup, the tally of arrests reaches eleven, with further actions taken in Uttar Pradesh.

title: Road crash victims to get cashless treatment: PM RAHAT claim limit, process explained
content: The government has launched the PM RAHAT scheme, offering cashless treatment up to Rs 1.5 lakh for road accident victims. This initiative aims to provide crucial medical care within the 'Golden Hour,' with a seven-day cover and quick claim settlement. Victims or Good Samaritans can access the service by dialing 112.

title: Blue Shirt Sets Fashion Trend: Royals and Vogue editors embrace WNU; signals shift to timeless style
content: A classic powder-blue button-down shirt from a London label is setting the fashion agenda, worn by Catherine, Princess of Wales, Meghan, Duchess of Sussex and Chloe Malle of American Vogue. This convergence signals a shift towards precision and polish in fashion, highlighting the enduring appeal of a perfectly cut shirt.

title: Pakistan: 2 killed, 14 injured in IED blast in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
content: A bomb blast near a police station in Pakistan's Bannu district has claimed at least two lives, including a child, and injured 14 others. The improvised explosive device, reportedly a time bomb attached to a motorcycle, detonated near shops. Authorities have cordoned off the area and launched a search operation, with officials condemning the act as an attack on peace.

title: On Camera, Train Stops Just In Time As Drunk Teen Sleeps On Tracks
content: A major mishap was averted at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) on Monday afternoon after a drunk teenager was discovered lying on the tracks of Platform No 1.

title: A Doctor's Death And Rs 60-Crore Property Without Legal Heirs
content: The doctor's funeral procession moved under administrative supervision from her Wright Town residence. But even before the flames were lit, a far more combustible question had already ignited the city - who inherits the empire she leaves behind?

title: 'Tehran' TV Series Producer Dana Eden Found Dead In Athens Hotel Room
content: TV producer Dana Eden, who co-created the hit Israeli spy thriller series "Tehran", has been found dead in a hotel room in central Athens, Greek police told AFP on Monday.

title: X Down For Thousands Of Users Worldwide, Including India
content: Elon Musk's social media platform X went down on Monday in a massive global outage, including in India.

title: Who Is Irina Ghose, Former Microsoft MD Now Leading Anthropic India?
content: Anthropic has appointed Irina Ghose, a former managing director at Microsoft India, to manage the AI startup's India operations.

title: Bombay High Court Says State Also Accountable For Goa Tragedy, Flags 'Systemic Failure'
content: The Bombay High Court at Goa has delivered a significant ruling in the wake of the December 2025 Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub tragedy, holding both the state government and the establishment's owners accountable for compensating the victims.

title: Anthropic Opens Bengaluru Office, Announces Partnerships Across Sectors
content: American artificial intelligence firm Anthropic on Monday announced it has opened a Bengaluru office, its second in Asia after Tokyo, and will focus on hiring local talent across a wide array of roles.

title: "Chances That We've Been Visited By Aliens...": Obama's Clarification
content: Former US President Barack Obama said he did not see evidence that aliens "have made contact with us," after sending social media abuzz by saying aliens were real on a podcast over the weekend.

title: 'AI Impact Summit Puts India Firmly On Global AI Map': Raghav Chadha
content: The AI Impact Summit 2026 has placed India firmly on the global map in shaping discussions around artificial intelligence and technology governance, Aam Aadmi Party MP Raghav Chadha said on Monday.

title: AI Impact Summit Triggers Traffic Congestion Across Delhi
content: Commuters at several parts of the national capital on Monday reported traffic congestion and travel delays, with enhanced security arrangements and traffic diversions coming into force for the five-day AI Impact Summit at the Bharat Mandapam.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Sonia-Rahul To Maken, Why Mani Shankar Aiyar Keeps Ditching His Verbal 'Filter'
content: The former Rajya Sabha parliamentarian used to joke that in the time of Rajiv Gandhi, he was on "arsh" (cloud nine), while in the UPA regime under Sonia Gandhi, he was brought down to "farsh" (ground).

title: AI Impact Summit 2026 Live Updates: PM Modi Inaugurates Mega Summit
content: The global artificial intelligence summit kicks off in New Delhi today with big issues on the agenda, from job disruption to child safety, with world leaders in attendance.

title: Watch: 22-Year-Old's Reel Attempt Ends Up In Police Rescue
content: A woman's attempt at a viral reel turned into a life-threatening ordeal after she fell into a gutter and had to be rescued by the Delhi Police.

title: Children Back At Odisha Anganwadi After BJP MP Eats Meal By Dalit Cook
content: MP and BJP national vice president Baijayant 'Jay' Panda on Sunday visited an Anganwadi centre in a village in Odisha's Kendrapara district and ate a meal prepared by a Dalit cook after villagers allegedly boycotted the centre.

title: 'Look To Finalise It In March': Top Official To NDTV On India-US Trade Deal
content: The India-US trade deal could be finalised as early as March -- this is what New Delhi is pushing for, Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal has told NDTV. He, however, said it is not a deadline.

title: Ontario Bets Big On India At AI Impact Summit, Seeks Deeper Tech Ties
content: At the AI Impact Global Summit in New Delhi, Ontario's Economic Development, Job Creation and Trade Minister Victor Fedeli struck an upbeat, business-first tone, pitching his province as the "cradle of artificial intelligence."

title: How Last Minute US Intervention Stopped UK's Plan To Bomb Israel In 1949
content: In January 1949, UK came within hours of launching a bombing mission on Tel Aviv after an aerial confrontation with Israeli forces over the Negev desert. The operation was cancelled only after direct intervention by then US President Harry Truman

title: 3 Sentenced To Death For Gang Rape Of Israeli Tourist, Murder Near Hampi
content: A sessions court in Karnataka's Koppal district on Monday sentenced three men to death after convicting them in the gang rape of two women, including an Israeli national, and the killing of a male tourist.

title: Telangana Civic Body Polls: BJP Skips Nizamabad Race, Wins Big In Karimnagar
content: Telangana's urban local body elections have thrown up sharp political contrasts for the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). While the party secured a decisive mayoral victory in Karimnagar, it has chosen to sit in the opposition in Nizamabad.

title: UPSC given a week’s time to file affidavit on software for visually impaired candidates
content: The apex court had on December 3, 2025, directed the UPSC to incorporate a provision allowing eligible candidates to request a change of scribe till at least seven days before the test

title: Forest dept. set to introduce coracle rides at Panamkuzhy Ecotourism Centre
content: The initiative is expected to increase visitor footfall at the ecotourism centre and help generate additional revenue

title: Women to redefine urban leadership with Congress candidates being the maximum
content: Out of the seven municipal corporations that went to polls in the State, three mayoral posts were reserved for women, and significantly, all the women mayors belong to the Congress, underlining the party’s overwhelming dominance

title: A. Suresh likely to be UDF candidate in Malampuzha
content: The former personal assistant to V.S. Achuthanandan has reportedly been invited to join the front. Suresh says he has shared his views with UDF leaders and it is now up to them to decide. Govindan says CPI(M) will not reconsider decision to expel Suresh

title: Two-year-old among three killed in separate road accidents
content: Angry passersby protested, demanding immediate repairs to the damaged roads, as well as measures to alleviate traffic congestion in that area

title: Madras High Court to hear Ponmudy’s petition against I-T assessment order after two weeks
content: Justice C. Saravanan directs the High Court Registry to list the case after two weeks since there had been a change in the counsel representing the I-T department

title: Death of student at coaching centre: parents seek justice
content: Parents Association of Andhra Pradesh seek the intervention of Education Minister and Commissioner of School Education in the matter

title: Minor girl’s death: police plan awareness drive on K-Pop influence
content: District Police Chief (Ernakulam Rural) suggested the need for an awareness drive as a preventive measure in the wake of the Chottanikkara incident, as well as the recent death of three sisters in Ghaziabad who were allegedly obsessed with Korean culture

title: Defence personnel attend private event in uniform, spark row
content: The presence of defence personnel in uniform at the private awards ceremony attended by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh drew the ire of retired military personnel

title: Need to redirect Kerala’s health focus from mere mortality reduction to improving healthy life expectancy, financial protection, and quality of life, say experts at Vision 2031 meet
content: The State will have to redesign the health system to meet the new challenges of chronic disease, aging, and equity, they say

title: Government silent on Pannun case, officials awaiting New York court documents
content: In New York court on Friday, Indian businessman Nikhil Gupta, accused in the Pannun murder plot case, pleaded guilty; the focus now turns to Vikash Yadav in India who was arrested in a separate case and out on bail

title: Srisailam celebrates Mahasivaratri Brahmostsavams with ‘Rathotsavam’, ‘Teppotsavam’
content: The chariot was adorned with 11 varieties of flowers such as marigold, chrysanthemum, roses and others; devotees pulled the chariot from the Gopuram to Nandi Circle and back

title: Transversal skills aid students in work, democratic participation: academic
content: University of Helsinki adjunct professor says development and transfer of competencies begin with teachers

title: Extend land reforms to plantation sector: Prabhat Patnaik
content: Prof. Patnaik, former vice-chairperson of the State Planning Board, was addressing a seminar held as part of the three-day ‘Vision 2031: An International Conference on Development and Democracy’

title: 10-year Left rule failed to ensure development of Kerala, alleges Rajeev Chandrasekhar
content: The project to set up an AIIMS failed to become a reality in the State as the government did not acquire the land in Kozhikode, alleges Rajeev Chandrasekhar

title: Domestic tourism in Kerala soars, foreign arrivals remain tepid
content: Domestic tourism in Kerala reached a record 2.58 crore visitors in 2025, with local travelers accounting for 2.5 crore, marking a 12.46% increase from the previous year. In contrast, foreign tourist arrivals remain sluggish at 8.2 lakh, still below pre-pandemic levels.

title: Watch: Akhilesh Yadav alleges targeted theft of PDA votes during SIR
content: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav has alleged large-scale irregularities in the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Uttar Pradesh, claiming that names of SP supporters, particularly from PDA communities, are being selectively deleted.

title: Forests in Kerala dry up early raising wildfire threats
content: Climate change and lack of rainfall in February the main causes. Proliferation of invasive plant species another major factor

title: From flood lessons to heat stress forecasts, experts outline AI roadmap for Kerala at ’Vision 2031’ meet
content: Eminent speakers air their ideas on ’Information Technology – Digital revolution in the era of AI’ at the Vision 2031 conference

title: Watch: Breaking boundaries: Director R. Gowtham brings Tamil independent cinema to Berlin
content: In this interview, Tamil filmmaker R. Gowtham opens up about creating his debut film with friends, poetry, instinct and zero industry backing. From Berlin, he reflects on community, doubt, and the unpredictable journey that brought him here.

title: Staff crunch cripples Town Planning Department after GHMC trifurcation
content: After the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation’s expansion and trifurcation, Hyderabad’s Town Planning wing faces crippling staff shortage, weakening oversight, stalling enforcement, and fuelling a surge of unauthorised constructions across the tri-corporation limits

title: ‘State setting up international standard facilities to foster growth of quantum technology’
content: India will stand first among the top 10 countries in quantum technology in the coming days, says Mission Director of Amaravati State Quantum Mission  Amaravati Quantum Valley

title: Human-wildlife conflict cases on the rise in Idukki; tusker ‘Padayappa’ destroys vehicle
content: The tusker is currently in musth and is travelling long distances under the cover of night;  forest department advises residents and tourists to maintain a safe distance from the animal

title: AP Chambers hails budget as pragmatic and growth-oriented
content: Says proposals balance welfare commitments with investments despite fiscal deficit pressures, calls for focus on Rare Earths Corridor, MSME parks, Amaravati and Polavaram projects to achieve Swarna Andhra Vision 2047

title: CM flags off police fleet
content: The new fleet comprises sport utility vehicles (SUVs) and motorcycles that are expected to strengthen police patrolling and Highway Police patrolling even in difficult and hilly terrains

title: NSS, SNDP hopeful of Kerala govt. ‘upholding Sabarimala custom’
content: CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan says the party’s line on the entry of women of all ages to Sabarimala does not preclude the government from taking an informed decision on the issue. Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan dares the government to withdraw the SC affidavit backing women’s entry to the temple

title: Centre’s nod to ₹135 crore drinking water project for Rajamahendravaram City
content: The source, from where water from Godavari river is being drawn for drinking water, is in question over the past few years.

title: Karnataka High Court orders inspection of Paying Guest accommodations to verify adherence to 10-point guidelines issued in 2024
content: The court has directed civic authorities to commence the inspection from February 18 and complete the process within two weeks

title: Kanthapuram meets Modi, seeks development of AMU Malappuram campus
content: Kerala Muslim Jamaat president discusses key issues affecting the Muslim community. He highlights the need for equitable resource allocation, minority education welfare schemes, and the protection of historic mosques.

title: Minister saying communal violence led to reduced investments in coastal region is true, says Dinesh Gundu Rao
content: ‘I do not have much information about Priyank Kharge’s stand on RSS and BJP. You better ask him,’ retorts Health Minister

title: Modi’s rooftop solar rollout lags despite subsidy push
content: Bank loan delays and poor State utility backing slow PM Surya Ghar scheme, threatening clean energy targets and prolonging coal reliance.

title: Trinamool Congress accuses Election Commission of violating spirit of Supreme Court order on documents for SIR
